byline.contributor: Dimitris Bounias contributed reporting from Athens, and James Kanter from Brussels.

abstract: Greece scrambles to erect camps for buildup of migrants stranded there by closing of border with Macedonia and disqualification of Afghans for political asylum; European Union approves emergency funding for situation but remains incapable of dispelling allure of Continent to refugees from violence and deprivation in Middle East.

headline.print_headline: Greece Becomes a Migrant Choke Point as Neighbors Shut Their Gates
headline.main: Greece Tries to House Migrants as Other Gates Close

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Camps have been opening in Greece at the rate of nearly one a day to house thousands of migrants who cannot move forward, and cannot or will not go back.
lead_paragraph: Camps have been opening in Greece at the rate of nearly one a day to house thousands of migrants who cannot move forward, and cannot or will not go back.
